poem:
Commander Butcher's Masquerade  

In the courtroom's humdrum light,  
a charlatan with fantasies of fright,  
clad in dull office attire,  
conjures Yuletide dread and ire.  

Santaclad shadows, sugar-coated woe,  
harbingers in white beard and red bow,  
the sinister stage fraying, unravelled,  
a pantomime menace, on sidewalks travelled.
